title: What has been the best decade for music in the past century? - Quora

response.answer_text: My list would be : 1960’s - The Beatles arrived in United States and subsequently performed on the Ed Sullivan show on their debut live television appearance on 9th February , 1964 which started the British Invasion phenomenon and carried Beatles’ own popularity from their native United Kingdom in the United States dubbed “ Beatlemania ’’ - their debut  live appearance on the Ed Sullivan TV show was watched by an estimated 73 million American viewers , The Beatles released their studio album - Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band (1967) which is often ranked as the greatest and best album of all time.1980’s - Michael Jackson performed his famous trademark dance move known as the “ moonwalk ’’ during his live television performance on his song “ Billie Jean ’’ on the 25th Motown Anniversary : Yesterday , Today , and Forever show on 25th March , 1983 , Michael Jackson released his studio album - Thriller (1982) which goes on and still is the biggest selling album of all time in music history with selling over 65 million copies worldwide.1970’s - John Lennon (founder of The Beatles) (post Beatles solo musical recording career) released his single “ Imagine ’’ from his studio album Imagine (1971) that goes on to be one of the greatest song of all time in music history.2000’s - Paul McCartney (bassist of The Beatles) (post Beatles solo musical recording career) performs his music set live  on the 2005 Superbowl Halftime show that goes on to be the then most watched entertainment event in history.1950’s - Elvis Presley infamously gyrated his hips and performed wild dance moves during his debut live television appearance on the Ed Sullivan show in 1956 , Elvis Presley released his single “ Heartbreak Hotel ’’ which was his 1st ever US Billboard Hot 100 number one single on the charts.1970’s - Bob Marley released his studio album - Exodus (1977) which is ranked as one of the greatest album of all time.1980’s - Madonna performed her hit song “ Like A Virgin ’’ on her debut live television appearance on the 1984 MTV VMAs (Video Music Awards) , Madonna released her single “ Like A Virgin ’’ from her studio album Like A Virgin (1984) that goes on to be one of the best selling / biggest selling single of all time worldw

When you look at Rolling Stone magazine’s list of the 500 Greatest Songs of All Time (compiled in 2004 and updated in 2010), you might be surprised to learn that nearly 40 percent of those songs come from a single decade. Which one? That would be the 1960s. The breakdown is as follows: 1940s : 2 songs, 0.4% 1950s : 68 songs, 13.6% 1960s : 196 songs, 39.2% 1970s : 131 songs, 26.2% 1980s : 55 songs, 11% 1990s: 22 songs, 4.4% 2000s: 26 songs, 5.2% These statistics are also reflected in the artists with the most songs on the list (1960s artists are in boldface) : The Beatles, 23 songs Bob Dylan, 15 songs The Rolling Stones, 14 songs Elvis Presley, 11 songs (both ‘50s and 60s) U2, 8 songs The Beach Boys, 7 songs Jim Hendrix, 7 songs Those with six songs each are Led Zeppelin, Prince, Sly and the Family Stone (both 60s and 70s), James Brown, and Chuck Berry. Source: Rolling Stone's 500 Greatest Songs of All Time - Wikipedia (By the way, if you want to collect the 500 songs and have a public library card, you should visit Freegal Music. So far I have been able to find and download nearly half of them — all for free — at this website.)
